description: {"blocks":[{"key":"et6nh","text":"This protocol covers the sample preparation for high-resolution confocal microscopy to visualize algal cells and their organelles (chloroplasts and mitochondria) by immobilizing them in agarose. The sample preparation includes preparing low-gelling agarose, staining the cells, and preparing the slides with live, but immobilized, algal cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"8kma2","text":"TAP medium (UTEX Media)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aruo","text":"Low gelling agarose (Sigma-Aldrich A9414-50G)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sgr6","text":"1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube (clear) (VWR 20170-038)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fcmq","text":"1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube (black and opaque) (VWR 470228-440) or aluminum foil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm463","text":"Vital dyes of interest (PKmito Orange (Spriochrome))","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vq5n","text":"18x18 mm #1.5 coverslip (VWR 48366-205)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aishs","text":"25x75x1 mm pre-cleaned glass slide (VWR 48300-026)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5omr7","text":"parafilm (Amcor)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f06j","text":"VALAP (1:1:1 mixture vasoline, lanolin, paraffin)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q9mt","text":"Forceps (EMS, 78317-2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v5o6","text":"wax pencil (Phano china marker, 79, red)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0o83","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g4k1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"400a4","text":"To make 1.25% low-melt agarose in TAP medium (which we use for Chlamydomonas cells), measure 3.75 mg of low-melt agarose and dissolve into 3 mL of TAP medium in a glass culture tube, then place it on a heat block set to 100 °C until the agarose dissolves. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":63,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vugl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"v0e5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6l39o","text":"You can maintain these small stocks of agarose at 45 °C and reuse them for one week. We recommend making fresh stocks after a week or if the agarose no longer appears transparent during imaging.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dsrru","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9covd","text":"If you find that your cells do not stay immobilized during imaging, consider adjusting the concentration of agarose.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20di6","text":"Once dissolved, move the tubes to a heat block set at 45 °C and let the mixture acclimate for at least 20 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ci6ag","text":"Pellet the cells by microcentrifugation 2000 × g for 2 min. Remove the supernatant and discard it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67lg0","text":"Scoop half of a sterile loop of cells (here we used Chlamydomonas reinhardtii and C. smithii) from a lawn plate and vigorously agitate the loop along the inside of a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube containing 500 µL of the medium for the experiment (TAP medium or ddH2O). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":52,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":81,"length":11},{"style":"sup","offset":263,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":263,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f19rn","text":"Prepare a working stock solution of vital dyes in an appropriate medium. For PKmito ORANGE, we used 1:500 in TAP medium. For staining two species of Chlamydomonas, we prepared 1 mL of dye to split (500 µl for each tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":149,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"916o3","text":"Leave the tubes with cells in a tube rack on the bench overnight with a light source illuminating them under a 12:12 hr light:dark cycle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bi79r","text":"Add 500 µL of the working stock of dye to each tube and mix by gently pipetting up and down, resuspending the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eudr3","text":"Transfer the cell/dye mixture to an opaque microcentrifuge tube (or wrap the tube with foil) to protect it from light and secure the cap with Parafilm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctrtj","text":"Place the tubes on a rotator to incubate with the dye for 45 min (at room temperature).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap1bl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3i7gv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"75bqt","text":"Adjust the incubation time for different types of vital dyes, but always keep them protected from light. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48ntu","text":"After incubation, pellet and wash the cells twice with fresh TAP medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jm1j","text":"Draw a small wax circle (using a wax pencil) on a #1.5 glass coverslip (18 × 18 mm) for each sample (two separate coverslips for two tubes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abjb1","text":"After removing the supernatant following the second wash, resuspend the pellet in 25 µL of the warmed (45 °C) agarose mixture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ktqe","text":"Pipette 1 µL of the agarose/cell mixture within the wax circle on the coverslip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et9n7","text":"Using forceps, carefully flip the coverslip onto a glass slide and seal the edges with VALAP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ir3g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8sa40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ctoet","text":"If you find that the cells are not close enough to the coverslip for the working distance of your objective, consider gently and evenly pressing down on the coverslip with forceps before sealing with VALAP.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

title: Immobilizing cells for live imaging
